parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To save, heal, preserve, rescue. From a primary sos; to save, i.e. Deliver or protect.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Plural
Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To seize, snatch, obtain by robbery. From a derivative of haireomai; to seize.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Fire; the heat of the sun, lightning; fig: strife, trials; the eternal fire. A primary word; 'fire'.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Plural
Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To pity, have mercy on. From eleos; to compassionate.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
(a) fear, terror, alarm, (b) the object or cause of fear, (c) reverence, respect. From a primary phebomai; alarm or fright.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To hate, detest, love less, esteem less. From a primary misos; to detest; by extension, to love less.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A tunic, garment, undergarment. Of foreign origin; a tunic or shirt.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To defile, spot, stain, soil. From spilos; to stain or soil.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Flesh, body, human nature, materiality; kindred.
